item.title: Fly tipping, 13th February
item.description:
This rubbish has been here since before Christmas. This is the 3rd time it has been reported. Why have the council done absolutely nothing about it?

item.title: Bus stop being misused as bus stand, 13th February
item.description:
Bennett’s coaches are pulling across our driveway parking from 7am to 7.30am mon-fri. This is a bus stop not a stand or termini it is causing an obstruction for normal buses and blocking access to our driveway and making a severe safety issue for access from our house to Shurdlington road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole not repaired properly, 13th February
item.description:
Pothole recently repaired has not been done properly and will cause damage to cars suspension and/or tyres. Stop wasting tax payers money and repair the whole road which has not been re-laid in over 30 years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Cloisters, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Very deep crater on junction with roundabout, 13th February
item.description:
Very deep and dangerous crater on roundabout! Will cause serious damage to cars/bikes! The state of this road is absolutely shocking! So may potholes/craters. Road is in terrible condition
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flow of water onto A40 due to a blockage in the channel under the road, 12th February
item.description:
There are 2 inspection hatches immediately next to the property boundary of Wood Bank House. Water has been flowing out of them since December - the water normally flows under the A40 towards Dowdeswell reservoir. The road is constantly wet with a stream of water flowing over it. When the rain becomes heavy, the overflow from the inspection hatches also flows across land owned by Wood Bank House before dropping onto the A40. This has been reported before and the report has been closed, but the problem is ongoing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: About 200 meters of the road has been unmaintained for a long time, 12th February
item.description:
Hello, I would like to report a damaged and potentially dangerous road surface in Cheltenham. The issue is located at: B4634, Cheltenham, Oldham Gloucester road. The problem is: [e.g. large pothole / broken road surface / damaged pavement]. It could be dangerous for drivers, cyclists, or pedestrians. Please could this be inspected and repaired as soon as possible. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham

item.description:
